events.name: Windows 10 webinar series local Meetup – Windows 10 for device management
events.description: Dear all,  you may have heard of the upcoming live Windows 10 Webinar series or have signed up for it. For the session by MVP Senthamil, we will be hosting a get together where you can watch MVP Senthamil record his webinar and speak with him. We will also have guest presentations by the Microsoft Windows team here in Singapore for you to find out more. Please join us and get a free Windows 10 t-shirt and upgrade thumb drives too. (Limited to 50 pax and first come first serve basis) Agenda: 10:00am to 11:00am - Windows 10 for device management (LIVE streaming/webcast on Channel 9) Content and demonstration on how Windows 10 helps businesses of any size deliver the full mobility experience for employees and simplifies device management. Our expert will demonstrate how to use different Active Directory setups to seamlessly manage identities. By Senthamil Selvan - App expert and Microsoft MVP in Windows Development, who has published 13 Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8 Apps. 11:00am to 11:15am – Q&A Session with MVP Senthamil Catch Senthamil if you have any questions related to Windows 10 or MDM. 11:15am to 11:30am - Windows 10 for the consumer There are people in the world who have Windows DNA – those compelled to set ideas into action and move the world forward. Windows empowers people of action to do great things and now has over 200M active worldwide. Join us as we share about how we are changing the way Windows works to give you an up to date, secure, personal and productive experience across your devices, and improve the way you work.  By Sarah Thiam - Sarah is the Windows Marketing Manager in Microsoft Singapore who manages programs to jumpstart and support Windows deployment in commercial segments and overlooks campaigns and communications to end users in Singapore 11:30am to 12:00pm – Windows 10 in the Enterprise Since the launch of Windows 10 last July, we have seen unprecedented demand for Windows 10 among enterprise and education customers. As of January 2016, more than 76% of our enterprise customers are in active pilots of Windows 10, and we now have over 22 million devices running Windows 10 across enterprise and education customers. Come join us to learn how to be more productive at work, and check out the new methods of deployment, innovations and servicing model in Windows 10.  By Terence Lim - Terence is a Windows Technology Specialist in Microsoft Singapore, who works closely with local enterprise customers in their Windows 10 adoption journey through technical guidance and overall evangelism. 12:00pm – Lunch
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: #GetHired through Data Talent Draft (March Virtual Event)
events.description: * This is a virtual recruiting drive to help connect top data talent with top opportunities * Candidate Signup Page: http://pxl.me/dtdc Recruiter Signup Page: http://pxl.me/dtdr No long lines, No handshakes, until you're drafted!  AnalyticsWeek's Hire51 is bringing biggest data talent draft day to town. On last day of every month top data and analytics talent applicant will apply to world biggest recruiting drive to get top data opportunities to top data professionals. Apply to be drafted and you'll be contacted back in 3 weeks if your profile make into the cut for interview. Hire51's Data Talent Draft works tirelessly to connect top talent with top recruiting companies. . No awkword lines, no haggling to get heard, no competing with noise, and One easy process to connect top talent with top opportunities. When: Draft begins every last day of every month. Starting 6:00pm Where: In your own city.  Process:  For Talent  1. Applicant apply as Job Seeker form here 2. Anonymized candidates chosen by recruiters will be contacted via email in 3 weeks 3. Upon interview, successful drafted candidate is celebrated in #DataTalentDraft community If you're DRAFTED(interewed and hired), we have some awesome swags for you.  For Recruiter  1. Recruiters signup using the form at: http://math.im/dtdr  2. We will share anonymized candidate info and give a week to pick shortlisted candidates 3. Once recruiter shortlist winning profile, we will ask the candidate and send introduction Draft the Top Picked Talent and share your success with us.  How can I participate?  It's simple. If you are a job-seeker: Register here and fill the form. Be sure to put your best foot forward to make yourself shine while filling the form. That's it. You're done! No need to go anywhere. If you are lucky you should hear from one of the top companies partnering with us. Don't be discouraged if you don't hear from anyone as the draft will happen last day of every month and your profile will be circulated for next 3 months.  If you are a recruiter: Register here with your requirements and company details. -> Data Talent Draft Job-Seeker Signup @ http://math.im/dtdc -> Data Talent Draft Recruiter Signup @ http://math.im/dtdr <a href="https://talentdraft.eventbrite.com/?access=dtd"></a>

events.name: Bluemix SG Meetup #8: Getting started with Strongloop in Bluemix
events.description: This Session is a hands-on experience with StrongLoop and Bluemix to utlize powerful Node.js features to enterprise Level. This workshop is perfect for Mobile , web , API developers and technical leaders who want to learn how to use next-gen technology to revolutionize products and applications. StrongLoop Loopback which runs on top of Express web framework enables creating APIs , easily connecting to backend data sources and quickly compose scalable APIs . Pre-requisites: 1. Sign up for Bluemix - http://bit.ly/bluemixsg 2. Install NodeJS - http://nodejs.org 3. Install Git - http://git-scm.com  NUS Enterprise is our supporting partner and venue sponsor for this event.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Talk.CSS #4
events.description: Our next meet-up will be on 31 March at Tinkerbox Studios.  Terminal velocity: A frontender's guide to the command line by Sahil BajajLove it or hate it, if you're doing web development you will have to use the terminal at some point. There is no escape, might as well learn more about it.  Latest CSS news by Talk.CSSOur new regular segment which will cover latest updates in the realm of CSS and HTML. CSS Panel: On name-spacing and CSS architecture A bunch of front-end developers discussing their preferences on how they architect their CSS. Our motley group of panelists are: Chris Lienert, Zell Liew, Aysha Anggraini and Chen Hui Jing. Also, if you want to do a lightning talk, please let us know before the event starts. We're more than happy to slot you in. Any CSS-related topics at ANY level are welcome because we're all here to learn and share. :) =========================================== General info We try to keep our timing tight so make sure you arrive close to the start time. Use the hash tag #SingaporeCSS whenever the urge comes.  Even if you're not a speaker this time, and get a sudden flash of inspiration, we welcome lightning talks too. Just poke us before the event starts and we'll slot you in. Lastly, if you want to speak or help out with anything, please contact Hui Jing or Chris.

events.name: Elixir Meetup - the Phoenix Framework
events.description:
We're delighted to welcome Riza from Elixirdose to our meetup this month! About Riza: Professional developer includes PHP, Python, NodeJS via Meteor in the morning. Elixir developer at night. Running ElixirDose since November 2013 with 900-ish subscribers. Ex-CTO of CitizenLab, a Belgium startup. Almost got Elixir gig, but then decided to run my own startup called Hacktiv8. Startup enthusiast and host of AppsCoast: Indonesian Tech Startup Podcast. Also, run Elixir Jobs community over http://jobs.elixirdose.com. You all very welcome to join and contribute to the site as well. During meetup Riza will talk about Phoenix Framework and show us some live coding and demo application. Agenda 7:00 Doors open7:20 Riza from Elixirdose8:30 Wrap up If we have some time after the presentation we'll have a QA session. 


Venue and snacks are sponsored by Thoughtworks 


 





Riza's visit is sponsored by Kaligo

events.name: Humla Workshop: Android­ - An attackers perspective.
events.description: We are pleased to inform our Humla workshop on Android Security Testing by Sai Sathya narayan Venkatraman. Please note, this event is hands-on, we can accommodate only few selected participants. If you get selected, you will receive a mail from Humla champion by 30th March 2016. Selection Criteria: Selection ( 15-20 persons only ) will be based on the following two criteria: 1. Contribution to the community. Speakers, humla, bachav champions, core team and venue hosts will get priority to the workshop.  2. Passion towards Information security + the attendance in previous meet ups.  If you are new to the community, selection will be based on the answers to the survey questions asked during the registration process. Agenda "Android" -- An attackers perspective" This workshop gives you hands on experience in identifying and exploiting the latest categories of vulnerabilities against modern Android applications based on real world examples. You’ll use the latest testing tools to assess, unravel and exploit applications, and learn about vulnerability classes unique to Android.  You will learn:-  -To analyze applications from an attacker’s perspective. - Basic understanding of the latest attack vectors against Android applications - To perform black box security assessments against real world applications using the latest and widely used tools Who should attend:  Anyone who is interested in Android security. What should I bring with me: Your own laptop. Null humla champion: Sai is currently working as security consultant at MWR Infosecurity (Singapore). Prior to that he was senior security analyst at a major financial institution(Citi) based in Singapore, where he worked as an information security analyst. Sai worked at Temasek Labs (NUS, Singapore) as Research Scientist, Indian Institute of Science(IISc, Bangalore) as Research Associate on security projects, focused on binary analysis, intrusion detection systems. Sai holds double Masters of Science(Research) in Information Security at National University of Singapore, Singapore and International Institute of Information Technology-Hyderabad, where he published half a dozen  research papers in significant areas of system security at NDSS, ESORICS, ACISP, ICICS, ICECCS. He also holds a bachelors degree in Technology of Computer Science. Please reach out to Humla champion, if you have any questions regarding the event.
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community
